article_title: Lessons From Hawaii's Trailblazing ACA 1332 Waiver Proposal
article_text:
Lessons From Hawaii's Trailblazing ACA 1332 Waiver Proposal

Law360, New York (October 13, 2015, 1:04 PM ET) -- Joel S. Ario



Spencer F. Manasse On Sept. 9 Hawaii became the first state to post a draft 1332 waiver proposal for public comment. While Hawaii’s waiver proposal is focused on the state’s unique 40-year-old employer mandate, the 40-page proposal illuminates the procedural and substantive issues that other states will have to address in moving forward with 1332 waiver proposals.



What Are 1332 Waivers?



Section 1332 of the Affordable Care Act authorizes states to request waivers from the U.S. Departments of Health and Human Services and...

To view the full article, register now.

article_metadata.description: Hawaii recently became the first state to request that certain aspects of the Affordable Care Act be waived, highlighting some of the procedural and substantive issues that other states will have to address in moving forward with Section 1332 waiver proposals, say Joel Ario and Spencer Manasse at Manatt Phelps & Phillips LLP.
